question: What is the purpose of MOAs?
choices: A. To protect military aircraft operations from civil aircraft.
B. To separate military training activities from IFR traffic.
C. To separate military training activities from both IFR and VFR traffic.
explanation: Military operations areas (MOAs) are established to separate IFR traffic from military training activities.

question: Military training routes (MTR) above 1,500 feet are depicted on
choices: A. IFR Low Altitude En Route Charts.
B. IFR High Altitude En Route Charts.
explanation: IFR Low-Altitude En Route Charts depict all MTRs that accommodate operations above 1,500 ft.
